name: Donaldson–Thomas theory
summary: Donaldson–Thomas theory is a mathematical theory concerning invariants that count sheaves on a type of space called a Calabi–Yau threefold. These invariants are a "virtual count" of points in a moduli space and are closely related to string theory and other areas of mathematics. They provide a way to count objects like curves and sheaves in a stable and consistent manner.
head: There is a compact moduli space of stable sheaves (or other objects in a Calabi-Yau 3-fold category).
tail: A virtual number (the Donaldson-Thomas invariant) can be calculated for this space, which provides a count of certain curves or BPS states.
